intro: Avenula hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's sedge, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, characteristic of the sedge family. Avenula hookeri is often found in coastal and freshwater habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native environment.
